subject: RE: [junit] Ant could not create task : junit
msgSnippet: ... It could be that when you re running ant from within Eclipse, you re not using the ant you think you re using.  That s happened to me before.  By default,
messageBody:
> I had problems running junit task and had to keep the junit jar
> (junit3.8.1.jar) in ant lib folder (ANT_HOME/lib) and use a
> <classpath /> with all the ant lib jars added to it.
>
> This works when I run the build script through ant from command line.
> The same build script will not work from within Eclipse. Not sure why.

It could be that when you're running ant from within Eclipse, you're not
using the ant you think you're using. That's happened to me before. By
default, Eclipse uses its own ant, which has its own ant/lib, which
doesn't come with the JUnit jars in it. My solution was to configure
Eclipse to use the same ant I used from outside Eclipse.


Todd.
